column4: Is there a list of network devices (usb, pci, or pcie) that are "guaranteed" to work with Ubuntu, whether it be 32 or 64 bit
like there is with Sane for the scanners
Ubuntu has a list of certified hardware. Most of drivers are in kernel so I hope they have a list too. :D
I ask that question because I haven't yet found something to help me with the installation of a USB Wifi key from D-link
Does `lsusb` command list it?
And what `ifconfig -a` shows?
I did ifconfig without prefacing with sudo.  It came back with no reference to the Wifi key I have
Which thing is the most interesting to look at, eth0, lo, or vboxnet 0?
eth0 is you ethernet, vboxnet is virtual nat for vbox
lo = loopback
When I did  do lsusb, it came back with Bus 002 Device 004: ID 2001:3c17 D-Link Corp.
can you give me the exact model?
As far as I can tell (nothing is written on the key), it is a DWA-135
Oh, that one... Did you try playing with ndiswrapper?
I know that it exists, but playing around with that, I haven't yet done
I think that's the only way. I could be wrong but installing windows drivers for such poorly supported devices is th eonly way if you ask me.
